Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Provinces[ENDCOLOR] is one of the new gameplay elements added by Cities in Development. They are a measurement of a city's territorial development and offer unique bonuses as they increase in level.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]State:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+3 Threshold.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upon (defensive) war, receive 2 Melee Units beginning with 50% of the XP provided by Buildings in this city.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Levies[ENDCOLOR] are Melee or Guns Units that can be conscripted from a city by expending its Population. You will also receive free Levies when a major war is declared against you (provided you are at peace at the time and have unlocked the Nobility tech), but these Levies will be disbanded once you return to peace. Levy Units in either case have less Max Hit Points and begin with less XP than regular Units.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Upgrading Provinces[ENDCOLOR] is done primarily through the construction of the Manor or Mansion National Wonder. These National Wonders require a specific number of Population or a specific number of Improved Tiles before they can be constructed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you are using Claims, the Great Magistrate may be used to instantly upgrade a Province.
+1 [ICON_PEACE] on Trading Posts, Villages, and Towns
It will upgrade into more advanced Improvements as it is worked.
Upgrades into more advanced Improvements as it is worked.

Towns are moderately sized settlements where people live who prefer the quietier country to hectic city. Travelers and city folk come to purchase and trade food, weapons, whiskey, gold, and all of the other trappings of society. They can generate an even larger amount of wealth for a society than Villages.

Villages are small settlements where people live who prefer the quietier country to hectic city. Travelers and city folk come to purchase and trade food, weapons, whiskey, gold, and all of the other trappings of society. They generate a larger amount of wealth for a society than Trading Posts.
This order will consume the unit and upgrade the city's Province level.
Unit must be stationed in a [ICON_JFD_BARONY] Municipality or [ICON_JFD_COUNTY] County level city.

Denotes a [ICON_JFD_BARONY] Muncipality.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] City Bombard Range.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+5% [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Organized Crime Threshold.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Levy Units begin with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25%[ENDCOLOR] of the XP provided Buildings in this city.

An assembly is a gathering called to address issues of importance to participants. Assemblies tend to be freely open to participation and operate by direct democracy. Some assemblies are of people from a location, some from a given workplace, industry or educational establishment others are called to address a specific issue.

Upgrades to a [ICON_JFD_COUNTY] County.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] City Bombard Range.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles is reduced by 10%.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-20% [ICON_JFD_DEVELOPMENT_SURPLUS] Needed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+5% [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Organized Crime Threshold.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Towns: +1 [ICON_GOLD].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive 1 [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levy Unit when a [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]MAJOR[ENDCOLOR] war is declared against you.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Levies begin with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]50%[ENDCOLOR] of the XP provided Buildings in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must have met the conditions for upgrading this city to a [ICON_JFD_COUNTY] County. See the Province breakdown for details.

A manor house is a large country house, which was historically the capital residence or messuage within a manor, the basic unit of territorial organisation in the feudal system in Europe, in which dwelled the lord of the manor. It formed the administrative centre of a manor and within its great hall were held the lord's manorial courts, communal meals with manorial tenants and great banquets. The term is today loosely applied to smaller country houses, frequently dating from the late medieval era, which formerly housed the gentry. They were often fortified, but this was frequently intended more for show than for defense. Manor houses existed in most European countries where feudalism existed, where they were sometimes known as castles, palaces, and so on. Many buildings, such as schools, are named Manor; the reason behind this is because the building was or is close to a manor house.

Upgrades to a [ICON_JFD_DUCHY] State.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+3 [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] City Bombard Range.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles is reduced by 30%.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-30% [ICON_JFD_DEVELOPMENT_SURPLUS] Needed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+5% [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Organized Crime Threshold.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Villages: +1 [ICON_GOLD], Towns: +1 [ICON_GOLD].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive 1 [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levy Units when a [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]MAJOR[ENDCOLOR] war is declared against you.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Levies begin with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR] of the XP provided Buildings in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must have met the conditions for upgrading this city to a [ICON_JFD_DUCHY] State. See the Province breakdown for details.

A mansion is a large dwelling house. The word itself derives from the Latin word mansio "dwelling", an abstract noun derived from the verb manere "to dwell". The English word "manse" originally defined a property large enough for the parish priest to maintain himself, but a mansion is no longer self-sustaining in this way (compare a Roman or medieval villa). 'Manor' comes from the same root—territorial holdings granted to a lord who would remain there—hence it is easy to see how the word 'Mansion' came to have its meaning.

Halves the effect of existing Provinces on [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and [ICON_BUILD] Improvement requirements when upgrading [ICON_JFD_COUNTY] Provinces. Provinces no longer require a [ICON_CONNECTED] Connection to the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital to be upgraded.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be constructed in the Capital. The cost goes up the more cities there are in the empire.

A National Wonder used to build up your Provinces quickly. Build this National Wonder outside your Capital to halve the effect of the number of existing Provinces on your Province prerequisites and to remove the Connection to Capital requirement. This is particularly useful for assimilated Colonies.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Commerce[ENDCOLOR] provides bonuses to empires focused on [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Commerce will boost [ICON_GOLD] Gold output in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital City by 25%. Unlocks building Big Ben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Commerce tree will grant +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from every Trading Post, Village, and Town. It also allows the purchase of Great Merchants with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Thought[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Trading Post, Village, and Town, and +17% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Universities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mobilization[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Receive an additional [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levy Unit whenever one is conscripted.
This Unit has been [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It has Max 50 HP.
This Unit has been [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levied. It will be disbanded when upon you return to peace with all current (major) foes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It has Max 50 HP.
This Unit has been [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It has Max 75 HP.
This Unit has been [ICON_JFD_LEVIES] Levied. It will be disbanded when upon you return to peace with all current (major) foes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It has Max 75 HP.
Create Governors to increase the empire's [ICON_JFD_DEVELOPMENT] Development.
Allows Levy Units to be recruited.
